org.genson
Interface Converter<T>

Type Parameters:
T - type of objects handled by this converter.
All Superinterfaces:
Deserializer<T>, Serializer<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BeanDescriptor, BeanViewConverter, ClassMetadataConverter, DefaultConverters.ArrayConverter, DefaultConverters.BooleanConverter, DefaultConverters.CollectionConverter, DefaultConverters.DateConverter, DefaultConverters.DoubleConverter, DefaultConverters.EnumConverter, DefaultConverters.IntegerConverter, DefaultConverters.LongConverter, DefaultConverters.MapConverter, DefaultConverters.NumberConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.booleanConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.doubleConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.intConverter, DefaultConverters.PrimitiveConverterFactory.longConverter, DefaultConverters.StringConverter, DefaultConverters.URLConverter, NullConverter, NullConverter.NullConverterWrapper, RuntimeTypeConverter
public interface Converter<T>
extends Serializer<T>, Deserializer<T>

Converter interface is a shorthand for classes who want to implement both serialization and deserialization. You should always privilege Converter instead of low level Serializer and Deseriliazer as they will be wrapped into a converter and all the ChainedFactory mechanism is designed for converters. Here is an example of a Converter of URLs. 

 Genson genson = new Genson.Builder().with(new Converter<URL>() {
 
        @Override
        public void serialize(URL url, ObjectWriter writer, Context ctx)
                        throws TransformationException, IOException {
                // you don't have to worry about null objects, as the library will handle them.
                writer.writeValue(obj.toExternalForm());
        }
 
        @Override
        public URL deserialize(ObjectReader reader, Context ctx) throws TransformationException,
                        IOException {
                return new URL(reader.valueAsString());
        }
 
 }).create();
 
 String serializedUrl = genson.serialize(new URL("http://www.google.com"));
 URL url = genson.deserialize(serializedUrl, URL.class);
As you can see it is quite straightforward to create and register new Converters. Here is an example dealing with more complex objects.

eugen
